info.title: API Documentation V2
info.description:
Authentication

API key must be provided in the X-API-Key header:
X-API-Key: {your-api-key-guid}

Note: V2 does not support query parameter authentication for security reasons. If header-based authentication presents integration challenges for your use case, please contact our support team to discuss alternative solutions.

get.description: Retrieves campaigns belonging to the authenticated organization. ### Behavior - Extracts and validates the API key (from header or query). - Authenticates the organization using the API key. - Retrieves campaigns ordered by name (descending). - Supports offset pagination via page + limit. - Supports cursor-based pagination via starting_after. - Returns a paginated response with TotalRecords, Page, and PageSize.

parameters.description: Cursor for next page (optional, for cursor-based pagination)

post.description:
Creates a new campaign associated with the authenticated organization.
            
Behavior:
- Extracts and validates API key (header/query).
- Authenticates org using API key.
- Checks campaign limit for the org variant (normal/PowerMode).
- Builds and saves the new campaign.
- Automatically creates a default sequence ('1') with onboarding if relevant.
- Returns details of the created campaign, or appropriate error.

Only minimal information is required; the system will set required fields.

get.description:
Retrieves all statistical data for the specified campaign in the authenticated organization.
            
Behavior:
- Validates API key/org and campaign existence.
- Optionally refreshes statistics when refresh=true (checks completion status, recalculates stats, processes A/B tests, clears caches).
- Verifies/normalizes date parameters and their ranges.
- Returns statistics for the specified date range.
            
Date Defaults (if not provided):
- dateStart: Campaign creation date
- dateEnd: Current date/time

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Campaign ID for which statistics are to be retrieved.

parameters.name: dateStart
parameters.description:
Optional. The start date (inclusive) for the statistics data range.
Accepts ISO 8601 format: yyyy-MM-dd or yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.fffZ (Z is optional, always interpreted as UTC).
If not provided, defaults to the campaign creation date.

parameters.name: dateEnd
parameters.description:
Optional. The end date (inclusive) for the statistics data range.
Accepts ISO 8601 format: yyyy-MM-dd or yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.fffZ (Z is optional, always interpreted as UTC).
If not provided, defaults to the current date.

parameters.name: refresh
parameters.description:
Optional. Set to true to force refresh campaign statistics before retrieval.
When true, recalculates all stats, processes A/B test variants, refreshes followups, and clears caches.
Defaults to false for faster response times.

post.summary: Send a reply to a received message.
post.description:
Sends an email reply to an existing received message.  
Supports quoting the original message, personalization placeholders, CC/BCC,  
sender override, and campaign-based tracking (opens/clicks).

Behavior:
- Validates the request and authentication.
- Retrieves the original received message by ID (from request body).
- Sanitizes the original body (removes tracking pixels and tracked links).
- Verifies user permissions to access the organization inbox.
- Selects the sender (original sender or `fromEmail` override).
- Builds the reply content and applies personalization.
- Optionally appends the quoted original message (`sendAsReply`).
- Applies tracking if required by the campaign.
- Sends the email via the external sending service.
- Stores a record of the sent reply.

Tracking And Personalization:
- Automatically adds tracking pixels and click-tracking if the message belongs to a tracked campaign.
- Personalization placeholders (e.g., {FirstName}, {Company}) are replaced with prospect data.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Reply details including message ID, recipient, body, subject, and options.

ApiErrorGeneric.description:
Standard error response following RFC 7807 Problem Details for HTTP APIs.
Technical metadata (timestamps, request IDs) is in HTTP headers, not body.

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem

status.description: HTTP status code (yes, redundant with HTTP, but RFC 7807 includes it for logging convenience)

ApiErrorValidation.description: Validation error response extending ProblemDetails with field-level error details

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem

status.description: HTTP status code (yes, redundant with HTTP, but RFC 7807 includes it for logging convenience)

field.description: Name of the field that failed validation

message.description: Human-readable error message for this field

attemptedValue.description: The invalid value that was attempted (optional, useful for debugging)

Campaign.description:
Campaign object represents a result/response for campaign resource. Campaign is the top-most concept in cold-email
sending and orchestrates email delivery to prospects with configurable scheduling, daily limits, and sender rotation.
Campaign contains an initial email plus multiple followups and sequences. Supports day-of-week scheduling, ESP matching,
progressive daily limit increases, and comprehensive statistics tracking.

campaignId.description: Unique identifier for the email campaign.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the campaign was created in the system.

folderId.description: Folder identifier for organizing and grouping campaigns; must be a positive integer.

name.description: Campaign display name for identification and organization; maximum 256 characters.

description.description: Optional description explaining the purpose or goal of this campaign; maximum 512 characters.

fromEmails.description: Comma-separated list of sender email addresses to use for sending campaign emails.

fromName.description: Display name shown in the From field of campaign emails; maximum 128 characters.

replyToEmail.description: Reply-to email address for prospect responses; must be valid email format with maximum 128 characters.

subject.description: Email subject line for the initial campaign email; maximum 4,000 characters.

body.description: HTML email body content for the initial campaign message.

textOnlyEmails.description: Send emails in plain text format only without HTML formatting.

ccEmails.description: Comma-separated list of email addresses to include as CC (carbon copy) recipients on all campaign emails.

bccEmails.description: Comma-separated list of email addresses to include as BCC (blind carbon copy) recipients on all campaign emails.

replyBccEmails.description: Comma-separated list of email addresses to BCC on prospect reply emails for internal tracking.

replyCcEmails.description: Comma-separated list of email addresses to CC on prospect reply emails for internal tracking.

sendUnsubscribeListHeader.description: Include List-Unsubscribe email header for compliance with email client unsubscribe features.

deactivateIfMissingPlaceholder.description: Automatically deactivate prospect from campaign if required email placeholder/merge tag is missing from their data.

stopCoworkersOnReply.description: Stop sending campaign emails to other team members (coworkers) targeting the same prospect when one receives a reply.

trackOpens.description: Enable tracking of email opens using pixel tracking.

trackClicks.description: Enable tracking of link clicks by replacing URLs with tracking redirects.

prospectValue.description: Estimated monetary value per prospect conversion for ROI tracking; must be a positive integer.

dailyLimit.description: Maximum number of emails this campaign can send per day; must be between 1 and 10,000.

dailyLimitPer.description:
Scope for applying the daily limit: 'sender' applies limit per sender account, 'campaign' applies limit across entire
campaign.

dailyLimitIncrease.description: Enable automatic progressive increase of the daily sending limit to gradually scale up capacity.

dailyLimitIncreaseToMax.description: Target maximum daily sending limit when progressive increase is enabled; must be between 0 and 10,000.

dailyLimitIncreasePercent.description:
Daily percentage increase applied to the sending limit when progressive increase is enabled; must be between 0 and
10,000.

dailyLimitOnDate.description: Current calculated daily limit after applying progressive increases.

dailyLimitPrioritize.description:
Email prioritization strategy when approaching daily limit: 'initial' prioritizes first emails, 'followup' prioritizes
follow-up emails.

dailyLimitInitial.description: Separate daily sending limit specifically for initial campaign emails; must be between 1 and 10,000.

dailyLimitInitialEnabled.description: Enable separate daily limit for initial campaign emails distinct from overall campaign limit.

dailyLimitWhichEmailsCount.description:
Which email types count toward daily limit: 'all' counts everything, 'initial' counts only first emails, 'followup'
counts only followups.

scheduleSending.description: Enable scheduled sending to control when campaign emails are sent during the day.

scheduleTimeZone.description: Timezone identifier for scheduling campaign sends (e.g., 'America/New_York', 'Europe/London'); maximum 64 characters.

useProspectsTimeZone.description: Enable feature to try and use prospects timezone when available

scheduleSendOnDate.description: Specific date to start sending this campaign when scheduled sending is enabled.

scheduleSendOnDateMinutes.description: Time of day in minutes after midnight to start sending on the scheduled date; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

scheduleSendOnDateEnabled.description: Enable the scheduled send date feature to start campaign on a specific date.

scheduleSendOnDateHours.description: Hour of the day (0-23) to start sending on the scheduled date when enabled.

delayMinMinutes.description:
Minimum delay in minutes between sending consecutive emails to avoid spam filters; must be between 1 and 1,440 (24
hours).

espMatchType.description: ESP (Email Service Provider) matching strategy type: 0=none, 1=match sender, 2=match domain.

espMatchEnabled.description: Enable ESP matching to send emails from senders that match prospect's email provider for better deliverability.

espLimitEnabled.description: Enable ESP limiting to restrict campaign sends to specific email service providers.

espLimitToMicrosoft.description: Include Microsoft email providers (Outlook, Hotmail, Live, etc.) when ESP limiting is enabled.

espLimitToGoogle.description: Include Google email providers (Gmail, G Suite) when ESP limiting is enabled.

espLimitToOther.description: Include other email providers beyond Microsoft and Google when ESP limiting is enabled.

sendMonAfter.description: Start time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Monday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendMonBefore.description: End time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Monday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendMon.description: Enable sending campaign emails on Monday.

sendTueAfter.description: Start time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Tuesday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendTueBefore.description: End time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Tuesday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendTue.description: Enable sending campaign emails on Tuesday.

sendWedAfter.description: Start time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Wednesday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendWedBefore.description: End time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Wednesday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendWed.description: Enable sending campaign emails on Wednesday.

sendThuAfter.description: Start time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Thursday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendThuBefore.description: End time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Thursday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendThu.description: Enable sending campaign emails on Thursday.

sendFriAfter.description: Start time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Friday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendFriBefore.description: End time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Friday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendFri.description: Enable sending campaign emails on Friday.

sendSatAfter.description: Start time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Saturday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendSatBefore.description: End time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Saturday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendSat.description: Enable sending campaign emails on Saturday.

sendSunAfter.description: Start time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Sunday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendSunBefore.description: End time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Sunday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendSun.description: Enable sending campaign emails on Sunday.

initialOpenCount.description: Number of email opens from initial campaign email only (excluding followups).

initialClickCount.description: Number of link clicks from initial campaign email only (excluding followups).

initialReplyCount.description: Number of replies from initial campaign email only (excluding followups).

initialBounceCount.description: Number of bounces from initial campaign email only (excluding followups).

prospectCount.description: Total number of prospects enrolled in this campaign.

activeProspectCount.description: Total number of prospects currently active and enrolled in this campaign.

sentCount.description: Total number of emails sent across all followups in this campaign.

openCount.description: Total number of email opens across all campaign emails.

clickCount.description: Total number of link clicks within all campaign emails.

bounceCount.description: Total number of bounce responses received across all campaign emails.

replyCount.description: Total number of replies received across all campaign emails.

initialInterestedCount.description: Number of prospects marked as interested from initial campaign email only (excluding followups).

interestedCount.description: Total number of prospects marked as interested across all campaign emails.

conversionCount.description: Total number of conversions tracked across all campaign emails.

initialConversionCount.description: Number of conversions from initial campaign email only (excluding followups).

CampaignCreate.description:
CampaignCreate object is used for creating a new campaign resource. Campaign is the top-most concept in cold-email
sending and orchestrates email delivery to prospects with configurable scheduling, daily limits, and sender rotation.
Campaign contains an initial email plus multiple followups and sequences. Supports day-of-week scheduling, ESP matching,
progressive daily limit increases, and comprehensive statistics tracking.

folderId.description: Folder identifier for organizing and grouping campaigns; must be a positive integer.

name.description: Campaign display name for identification and organization; maximum 256 characters.

description.description: Optional description explaining the purpose or goal of this campaign; maximum 512 characters.

fromEmails.description: Comma-separated list of sender email addresses to use for sending campaign emails.

fromName.description: Display name shown in the From field of campaign emails; maximum 128 characters.

replyToEmail.description: Reply-to email address for prospect responses; must be valid email format with maximum 128 characters.

subject.description: Email subject line for the initial campaign email; maximum 4,000 characters.

body.description: HTML email body content for the initial campaign message.

textOnlyEmails.description: Send emails in plain text format only without HTML formatting.

ccEmails.description: Comma-separated list of email addresses to include as CC (carbon copy) recipients on all campaign emails.

bccEmails.description: Comma-separated list of email addresses to include as BCC (blind carbon copy) recipients on all campaign emails.

replyBccEmails.description: Comma-separated list of email addresses to BCC on prospect reply emails for internal tracking.

replyCcEmails.description: Comma-separated list of email addresses to CC on prospect reply emails for internal tracking.

sendUnsubscribeListHeader.description: Include List-Unsubscribe email header for compliance with email client unsubscribe features.

deactivateIfMissingPlaceholder.description: Automatically deactivate prospect from campaign if required email placeholder/merge tag is missing from their data.

stopCoworkersOnReply.description: Stop sending campaign emails to other team members (coworkers) targeting the same prospect when one receives a reply.

trackOpens.description: Enable tracking of email opens using pixel tracking.

trackClicks.description: Enable tracking of link clicks by replacing URLs with tracking redirects.

prospectValue.description: Estimated monetary value per prospect conversion for ROI tracking; must be a positive integer.

dailyLimit.description: Maximum number of emails this campaign can send per day; must be between 1 and 10,000.

dailyLimitPer.description:
Scope for applying the daily limit: 'sender' applies limit per sender account, 'campaign' applies limit across entire
campaign.

dailyLimitIncrease.description: Enable automatic progressive increase of the daily sending limit to gradually scale up capacity.

dailyLimitIncreaseToMax.description: Target maximum daily sending limit when progressive increase is enabled; must be between 0 and 10,000.

dailyLimitIncreasePercent.description:
Daily percentage increase applied to the sending limit when progressive increase is enabled; must be between 0 and
10,000.

dailyLimitOnDate.description: Current calculated daily limit after applying progressive increases.

dailyLimitPrioritize.description:
Email prioritization strategy when approaching daily limit: 'initial' prioritizes first emails, 'followup' prioritizes
follow-up emails.

dailyLimitInitial.description: Separate daily sending limit specifically for initial campaign emails; must be between 1 and 10,000.

dailyLimitInitialEnabled.description: Enable separate daily limit for initial campaign emails distinct from overall campaign limit.

dailyLimitWhichEmailsCount.description:
Which email types count toward daily limit: 'all' counts everything, 'initial' counts only first emails, 'followup'
counts only followups.

scheduleSending.description: Enable scheduled sending to control when campaign emails are sent during the day.

scheduleTimeZone.description: Timezone identifier for scheduling campaign sends (e.g., 'America/New_York', 'Europe/London'); maximum 64 characters.

useProspectsTimeZone.description: Enable feature to try and use prospects timezone when available

scheduleSendOnDate.description: Specific date to start sending this campaign when scheduled sending is enabled.

scheduleSendOnDateMinutes.description: Time of day in minutes after midnight to start sending on the scheduled date; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

scheduleSendOnDateEnabled.description: Enable the scheduled send date feature to start campaign on a specific date.

scheduleSendOnDateHours.description: Hour of the day (0-23) to start sending on the scheduled date when enabled.

delayMinMinutes.description:
Minimum delay in minutes between sending consecutive emails to avoid spam filters; must be between 1 and 1,440 (24
hours).

espMatchType.description: ESP (Email Service Provider) matching strategy type: 0=none, 1=match sender, 2=match domain.

espMatchEnabled.description: Enable ESP matching to send emails from senders that match prospect's email provider for better deliverability.

espLimitEnabled.description: Enable ESP limiting to restrict campaign sends to specific email service providers.

espLimitToMicrosoft.description: Include Microsoft email providers (Outlook, Hotmail, Live, etc.) when ESP limiting is enabled.

espLimitToGoogle.description: Include Google email providers (Gmail, G Suite) when ESP limiting is enabled.

espLimitToOther.description: Include other email providers beyond Microsoft and Google when ESP limiting is enabled.

sendMonAfter.description: Start time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Monday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendMonBefore.description: End time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Monday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendMon.description: Enable sending campaign emails on Monday.

sendTueAfter.description: Start time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Tuesday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendTueBefore.description: End time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Tuesday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendTue.description: Enable sending campaign emails on Tuesday.

sendWedAfter.description: Start time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Wednesday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendWedBefore.description: End time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Wednesday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendWed.description: Enable sending campaign emails on Wednesday.

sendThuAfter.description: Start time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Thursday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendThuBefore.description: End time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Thursday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendThu.description: Enable sending campaign emails on Thursday.

sendFriAfter.description: Start time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Friday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendFriBefore.description: End time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Friday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendFri.description: Enable sending campaign emails on Friday.

sendSatAfter.description: Start time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Saturday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendSatBefore.description: End time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Saturday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendSat.description: Enable sending campaign emails on Saturday.

sendSunAfter.description: Start time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Sunday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendSunBefore.description: End time in minutes after midnight for sending emails on Sunday; must be between 0 and 1,439 (11:59 PM).

sendSun.description: Enable sending campaign emails on Sunday.

CampaignPage.description:
CampaignPage object represents a paginated list of campaign resources with cursor-based pagination. Campaign is the
top-most concept in cold-email sending and orchestrates email delivery to prospects with configurable scheduling, daily
limits, and sender rotation. Campaign contains an initial email plus multiple followups and sequences. Supports
day-of-week scheduling, ESP matching, progressive daily limit increases, and comprehensive statistics tracking.

items.description: Array of items in the current page

pagination.description: Pagination metadata with typed primary key support

CampaignStats.description: Campaign statistics with time-series data for various metrics

timeline.description: Common timeline for all series data points (x-axis values)

sentSeries.description: Total messages sent per time period

sentInitialSeries.description: Initial messages sent (excluding followups) per time period

followupStats.description: Breakdown of statistics by individual followup emails

CampaignStatsFollowup.description: Statistics for individual followup emails within a campaign

followupId.description: Unique identifier of the followup email

sentSeries.description: Messages sent for this specific followup per time period

count.description: Count values aligned with the parent Timeline array

openCount.description: Reference open count for specific metric aligned with the parent Timeline array

Clientspace.description:
Clientspace object represents a result/response for clientspace resource. Clientspace is a whitelabel sub-organization
allowing agencies to provide fully branded platforms to clients. Clientspace functions as a workspace with additional
whitelabel capabilities, featuring its own users, campaigns, prospects, and API key with complete data isolation.

clientspaceId.description: Unique identifier for the clientspace (whitelabel sub-organization) within the agency.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the clientspace was created in the system.

title.description: Display name of the clientspace; maximum 256 characters.

apiKey.description: API key for authenticating requests made on behalf of this clientspace, represented as a GUID.

separateCredits.description:
Indicates whether the clientspace has a separate credit pool independent from the parent agency, allowing dedicated
credit allocation for this client.

autoAllocate.description: Enables automatic recurring credit allocation to the clientspace, useful for subscription-based credit provisioning.

creditAmount.description:
The number of credits to allocate when auto-allocation is enabled, defining the recurring credit amount for this
clientspace.

ClientspaceCreate object is used for creating a new clientspace resource. Clientspace is a whitelabel sub-organization
allowing agencies to provide fully branded platforms to clients. Clientspace functions as a workspace with additional
whitelabel capabilities, featuring its own users, campaigns, prospects, and API key with complete data isolation.

title.description: Display name of the clientspace; maximum 256 characters.

separateCredits.description:

autoAllocate.description: Enables automatic recurring credit allocation to the clientspace, useful for subscription-based credit provisioning.

creditAmount.description:
The number of credits to allocate when auto-allocation is enabled, defining the recurring credit amount for this
clientspace.

Error.description:
Error object represents a result/response for error resource. Error is an audit record capturing errors across
the email campaign platform including sending failures, receiving issues, warmup disconnections, and system errors.
Error provides observability and troubleshooting capabilities with references to associated campaigns, senders,
prospects, and followups along with detailed error messages and server context for distributed debugging.

errorId.description: Unique identifier for the error record.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the error occurred in UTC.

campaignId.description: Campaign associated with this error if the error occurred during campaign operations.

followupId.description: Followup email associated with this error if the error occurred during followup sending.

senderId.description: Sender account associated with this error if the error occurred during sending or receiving operations.

action.description: Error action code or category identifying the type of error (e.g. send_gmail_oauth, receive_imap, warmup_disconnected).

context.description: Reference value providing additional context such as email address, ID, or other identifiers; maximum 128 characters.

message.description: Short error message providing a brief description of what went wrong; maximum 512 characters.

description.description: Detailed error description including stack traces and additional context for debugging; maximum 4000 characters.

ErrorPage.description:
ErrorPage object represents a paginated list of error resources with cursor-based pagination. Error is an audit record
capturing errors across the email campaign platform including sending failures, receiving issues, warmup disconnections,
and system errors. Error provides observability and troubleshooting capabilities with references to associated
campaigns, senders, prospects, and followups along with detailed error messages and server context for distributed
debugging.

items.description: Array of items in the current page

pagination.description: Pagination metadata with typed primary key support

Followup.description:
Followup object represents a result/response for followup resource. Followup is an automated email message sent
after the initial campaign email based on wait times and conditions. Followup can send as a reply in the same thread and
includes tracking statistics for opens, clicks, and replies.

followupId.description: Unique identifier for the followup email.

sequenceId.description: Sequence identifier that this followup belongs to, if part of a conditional sequence.

subject.description: Email subject line for this followup; maximum 1,024 characters.

body.description: HTML email body content for this followup message.

waitMin.description: Wait time duration before sending this followup; must be an integer between 1 and 1000

waitUnits.description: Time unit for the wait period (e.g., 'minutes', 'hours', 'days').

useOriginalSubject.description: Use the original campaign subject line instead of a custom subject for this followup.

sendInSameThread.description: Send this followup as a reply in the same email thread as the initial campaign email.

replyInThread.description: Reply as a thread to the original email conversation.

replyInThreadToFollowupId.description: Reference to a specific earlier followup ID to reply to within the thread; must be a positive integer.

sentCount.description: Total number of times this followup email was sent to prospects.

openCount.description: Total number of times this followup email was opened by recipients.

clickCount.description: Total number of link clicks within this followup email.

bounceCount.description: Total number of bounce responses received for this followup email.

interestedCount.description: Total number of prospects marked as interested from this followup email.

replyCount.description: Total number of replies received to this followup email.

FollowupCreate.description:
FollowupCreate object is used for creating a new followup resource. Followup is an automated email message sent after the
initial campaign email based on wait times and conditions. Followup can send as a reply in the same thread and includes
tracking statistics for opens, clicks, and replies.

subject.description: Email subject line for this followup; maximum 1,024 characters.

body.description: HTML email body content for this followup message.

waitMin.description: Wait time duration before sending this followup; must be an integer between 1 and 1000

waitUnits.description: Time unit for the wait period (e.g., 'minutes', 'hours', 'days').

useOriginalSubject.description: Use the original campaign subject line instead of a custom subject for this followup.

sendInSameThread.description: Send this followup as a reply in the same email thread as the initial campaign email.

replyInThread.description: Reply as a thread to the original email conversation.

replyInThreadToFollowupId.description: Reference to a specific earlier followup ID to reply to within the thread; must be a positive integer.

items.description: Array of items in the current page

pagination.description: Pagination metadata with typed primary key support

List.description:
List object represents a result/response for list resource. List is a collection organizing and grouping
prospects for campaign management. List belongs to a folder and can contain multiple prospects. List can be shared
across the organization or kept private to users.

listId.description: Unique identifier for the mailing list.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the list was created in the system.

folderId.description: Folder identifier for organizing and grouping lists; must be a positive integer.

title.description: Display name of the mailing list; maximum 256 characters.

ListCreate.description:
ListCreate object is used for creating a new list resource. List is a collection organizing and grouping prospects
for campaign management. List belongs to a folder and can contain multiple prospects. List can be shared across the
organization or kept private to users.

folderId.description: Folder identifier for organizing and grouping lists; must be a positive integer.

title.description: Display name of the mailing list; maximum 256 characters.

ListPage.description:
ListPage object represents a paginated list of list resources with cursor-based pagination. List is a collection
organizing and grouping prospects for campaign management. List belongs to a folder and can contain multiple prospects.
List can be shared across the organization or kept private to users.

items.description: Array of items in the current page

pagination.description: Pagination metadata with typed primary key support

ListUpdate.description:
ListUpdate object is used for updating an existing list resource. List is a collection organizing and grouping
prospects for campaign management. List belongs to a folder and can contain multiple prospects. List can be shared
across the organization or kept private to users.

folderId.description: Folder identifier for organizing and grouping lists; must be a positive integer.

title.description: Display name of the mailing list; maximum 256 characters.

Message.description:
Message object represents a result/response for message resource. Message is a unified representation of email
messages in the platform, containing both sent messages and replies. Message includes tracking information for opens and
clicks, email content, and relationships to campaigns and followups for comprehensive email thread management.

messageId.description: Unique identifier for the message, using either SentID or ReplyID depending on the message type.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the message was created or sent.

type.description: Message type indicating whether this is a sent message or a reply. Valid values: SENT or REPLY.

campaignId.description: ID of the campaign this message is associated with, if applicable.

followupId.description: Followup ID (FUID) associated with this message, if applicable.

body.description: The body content of the email message. HTML content should be handled or sanitized appropriately on the client side.

openCount.description: Number of times this message was opened. Only applicable to SENT messages.

clickCount.description: Number of times links in this message were clicked. Only applicable to SENT messages.

clickDetails.description: Detailed click tracking information for links in the message. Only applicable to SENT messages.

MessagePage.description:
MessagePage object represents a paginated list of message resources with cursor-based pagination. Message is a unified
representation of email messages in the platform, containing both sent messages and replies. Message includes tracking
information for opens and clicks, email content, and relationships to campaigns and followups for comprehensive email
thread management.

items.description: Array of items in the current page

pagination.description: Pagination metadata with typed primary key support

MessageReply.description: Request model for sending an email reply to a received message.

messageId.description:
ID of the received message to reply to. This is the Message-ID from the email headers.
Required field.

subject.description:
Email subject line for the reply. If omitted, the original message subject will be used.
Maximum 4,000 characters.
subject.example: Re: Your inquiry about our services

body.description:
HTML email body content for the reply. Can include personalization placeholders 
(e.g., {FirstName}, {Company}) that will be replaced with prospect data.
If SendAsReply is true, the original message will be appended as a quoted block.
body.example: <p>Thank you for your message. Here's my response...</p>

ccEmails.description:
Comma-separated list of email addresses to include as CC (carbon copy) recipients.
Each email address must be valid. Example: "cc1@example.com,cc2@example.com"

bccEmails.description:
Comma-separated list of email addresses to include as BCC (blind carbon copy) recipients.
Each email address must be valid. Example: "bcc1@example.com,bcc2@example.com"

sendAsReply.description:
If true, appends the original received message as a quoted reply block in the email body.
The quoted text will include the original sender, timestamp, and message content.
Default: false

fromEmail.description:
Sender email address to use for the From header. Must be a valid, configured sender 
account in your organization. If omitted, the system will use the sender from the 
original received message. Must be a valid email format.

replyToEmail.description:
Email of the prospect you're replying to (optional). If left empty, it will reply to the thread prospect's email. 
If passed, it will take precedence

PaginationDateTime.description: Generic pagination metadata for list responses with typed cursor support

totalItems.description: Total number of items across all pages

nextCursor.description:
Cursor for next page (cursor-based pagination)
Type depends on the resource's primary key type

PaginationGuid.description: Generic pagination metadata for list responses with typed cursor support

totalItems.description: Total number of items across all pages

nextCursor.description:
Cursor for next page (cursor-based pagination)
Type depends on the resource's primary key type

PaginationInteger.description: Generic pagination metadata for list responses with typed cursor support

totalItems.description: Total number of items across all pages

nextCursor.description:
Cursor for next page (cursor-based pagination)
Type depends on the resource's primary key type

Prospect.description:
Prospect object represents a result/response for prospect resource. Prospect is an individual contact receiving
campaign emails, organized by lists and tags. Prospect contains contact information, company details, custom fields for
personalization, and sending status for campaign management.

prospectId.description: Unique identifier for the prospect record.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the prospect was created in the system.

email.description: Email address of the prospect; must be valid email format with maximum 256 characters.

baseListId.description: Base mailing list identifier that this prospect belongs to; must be a positive integer.

sendingStatus.description: Current sending status code indicating the prospect's campaign participation state.

sendingActive.description: Indicates whether the prospect is active and eligible for sending in campaigns.

industry.description: Industry sector or business category of the prospect's company; maximum 512 characters.

city.description: City where the prospect is located; maximum 512 characters.

firstName.description: Prospect's first name for personalization; maximum 512 characters.

lastName.description: Prospect's last name for personalization; maximum 512 characters.

company.description: Company name where the prospect works; maximum 512 characters.

country.description: Country where the prospect is located; maximum 512 characters.

domain.description: Company domain name extracted from email or website; maximum 180 characters.

companySize.description: Company size description or employee count range; maximum 32 characters.

ProspectImport.description:
ProspectImport object represents a result/response for prospectimport resource. ProspectImport is a summary of results
from bulk prospect import operations. ProspectImport tracks the number of prospects processed, inserted, updated,
duplicates removed, list subscriptions created, and campaign assignments, providing comprehensive feedback on bulk data
operations.

totalProcessed.description: Total number of prospects processed in the bulk operation including both inserts and updates.

prospectsInserted.description: Number of new prospects inserted into the database during the bulk operation.

prospectsUpdated.description: Number of existing prospects updated with new information during the bulk operation.

duplicatesInBatch.description: Number of duplicate prospect entries identified and removed from the batch before processing.

subscriptionsAdded.description: Number of list subscriptions created associating prospects with the specified list.

campaignAdded.description: Number of prospects added to the campaign for email sending; only applicable when campaign is specified.

Sender.description:
Sender object represents a result/response for sender resource. Sender is an email account used to send campaign
emails. Sender is configurable with custom SMTP/IMAP settings, warmup configurations, and daily sending limits. Sender
can be associated with multiple campaigns and supports rotation to distribute sending across accounts.

senderId.description: Unique identifier for the sender account.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the sender account was created in the system.

email.description: Email address of the sender account used for outgoing campaigns; must be valid email format with maximum 100 characters.

folder.description: Organizational folder name for grouping and categorizing sender accounts; maximum 64 characters.

fromName.description: Display name shown as the sender in outgoing emails; maximum 128 characters.

accountType.description: Type of sender account: customsmtp, gmailsmtp, gmailoauth, msoauth, sendgridapi

replyTo.description:
Reply-to email address for responses to campaigns; must be valid email format, maximum 128 characters. If set, Unibox
will not catch replies unless Reply-to sender is also connected as sender.

firstName.description: Sender's first name used for personalization in campaigns; maximum 128 characters.

lastName.description: Sender's last name used for personalization in campaigns; maximum 128 characters.

signature.description: Email signature HTML content appended to the bottom of outgoing messages.

trackingDomain.description: Custom domain used for tracking links and open tracking in emails; maximum 256 characters.

delayMin.description:
Minimum delay in seconds between sending consecutive emails from this sender to avoid triggering spam filters; default
120 seconds.

dailyLimit.description: Maximum number of emails this sender can send per day; must be between 1 and 10,000.

dailyLimitIncrease.description: Enable automatic progressive increase of the daily sending limit to scale up sending capacity over time.

dailyLimitIncreaseToMax.description: Target maximum daily sending limit when using progressive increase; must be greater than current daily limit.

dailyLimitIncreasePercent.description: Daily percentage increase applied to the sending limit when progressive increase is enabled; must be between 1 and 100.

warmup.description: Enable warmup to gradually build sender reputation.

warmupDailyLimitIncrease.description: Enable progressive daily limit increase specifically during the warmup period to gradually build sender reputation.

warmupDailyLimitIncreaseToMax.description: Target maximum daily sending limit to reach during the warmup phase; must be between 1 and 10,000.

warmupDailyLimitIncreasePercent.description: Daily percentage increase of the sending limit during warmup period; must be between 1 and 10,000.

warmupDailyLimit.description: Initial daily sending limit when starting the warmup process; default 10 emails per day.

warmupReplyPercent.description:
Percentage of warmup emails that will receive automated replies to simulate natural conversation; must be between 1 and
100.

warmupSkipWeekends.description: Skip sending warmup emails on Saturday and Sunday to simulate natural business communication patterns.

customWarmupTag.description: Custom tag applied to emails sent during warmup phase for tracking and filtering purposes; maximum 64 characters.

customSmtpServer.description: SMTP server hostname for custom email sending configuration; maximum 128 characters.

customSmtpPort.description: SMTP server port number for custom email sending configuration.

customSmtpUsername.description: Custom SMTP username if different from the sender email; maximum 128 characters.

customImapServer.description: IMAP server hostname for custom email retrieval configuration; maximum 128 characters.

customImapPort.description: IMAP server port number for custom email retrieval configuration; typically 993 for SSL/TLS; maximum 64 characters.

customImapUsername.description: Custom IMAP username if different from the sender email; maximum 128 characters.

disconnected.description:
Indicates whether the sender account is currently disconnected from the email provider due to authentication or
connection issues.

dateDisconnected.description: Timestamp when the sender account was disconnected from the email provider.

disconnectionReason.description: Reason why the sender account was disconnected; maximum 128 characters.

dateWarmupDisconnected.description: Timestamp when the sender was removed from the public warmup network.

warmupRemovalReason.description: Reason why the sender was removed from the public warmup network; maximum 128 characters.

senderCustom1.description: Custom field 1 for storing additional sender-specific data; maximum 4,000 characters.

senderCustom2.description: Custom field 2 for storing additional sender-specific data; maximum 4,000 characters.

senderCustom3.description: Custom field 3 for storing additional sender-specific data; maximum 4,000 characters.

senderCustom4.description: Custom field 4 for storing additional sender-specific data; maximum 4,000 characters.

senderCustom5.description: Custom field 5 for storing additional sender-specific data; maximum 4,000 characters.

Sequence.description:
Sequence object represents a result/response for sequence resource. Sequence is a conditional branch within a
campaign containing followup emails triggered by prospect actions like opens, clicks, or replies. Sequence has
configurable conditions and operators controlling when prospects enter the sequence path and receive associated emails.

sequenceId.description: Unique identifier for the email sequence.

name.description: Descriptive name of the sequence; maximum 64 characters.

shortName.description: Short abbreviated name for quick reference in reporting and UI; maximum 8 characters.

conditionExtra.description: Apply an additional condition to trigger this sequence beyond the base conditions.

conditionNegate.description: Negate (invert) the sequence trigger condition logic.

conditionTimes.description: Number of times the condition must be met before triggering the sequence; must be between 0 and 100.

conditionReply.description: Reply-based condition operator for triggering this sequence.

conditionAction.description: Action-based condition type for triggering this sequence.

conditionOperator.description: Comparison operator for evaluating sequence conditions.

SequenceUpdate.description:
SequenceUpdate object is used for updating an existing sequence resource. Sequence is a conditional branch within a
campaign containing followup emails triggered by prospect actions like opens, clicks, or replies. Sequence has
configurable conditions and operators controlling when prospects enter the sequence path and receive associated emails.

name.description: Descriptive name of the sequence; maximum 64 characters.

shortName.description: Short abbreviated name for quick reference in reporting and UI; maximum 8 characters.

conditionExtra.description: Apply an additional condition to trigger this sequence beyond the base conditions.

conditionNegate.description: Negate (invert) the sequence trigger condition logic.

conditionTimes.description: Number of times the condition must be met before triggering the sequence; must be between 0 and 100.

conditionReply.description: Reply-based condition operator for triggering this sequence.

conditionAction.description: Action-based condition type for triggering this sequence.

conditionOperator.description: Comparison operator for evaluating sequence conditions.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the tag was created in the system.

title.description: Tag name used for organizing and categorizing prospects; maximum 128 characters.

description.description: Optional description explaining the purpose or criteria for this tag; maximum 1,000 characters.

TagCreate.description:
TagCreate object is used for creating a new tag resource. Tag is a label organizing and categorizing prospects for
segmentation and filtering. Tag provides flexible categorization where each prospect can have multiple tags, enabling
advanced targeting and prospect management across campaigns.

title.description: Tag name used for organizing and categorizing prospects; maximum 128 characters.

description.description: Optional description explaining the purpose or criteria for this tag; maximum 1,000 characters.

User.description:
User object represents a result/response for user resource. User is an account with platform access for
managing campaigns, prospects, and other resources within their organization. User has a unique identifier, email
address, and role-based permissions controlling access level and capabilities.

userId.description: Unique identifier for the user account, represented as a GUID.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the user account was registered in the system.

email.description: Email address of the user account; must be valid email format with maximum 128 characters.

emailConfirmed.description: Indicates whether the user has confirmed their email address through the verification process.

firstName.description: User's first name for identification and personalization; maximum 512 characters.

lastName.description: User's last name for identification and personalization; maximum 512 characters.

accountType.description:
User's permission level: 110 - SuperAdmin, 100 - Admin, 30 - User, 23 - SenderOnly, 22 - ReportOnly, 21 - Unibox Only
etc...

Whitelabel.description:
Whitelabel object represents a result/response for whitelabel resource. Whitelabel is a branding configuration
controlling the visual appearance and identity of the platform. Whitelabel includes custom colors, logos, and domain
configurations for client-facing interfaces, enabling agencies to deliver fully branded experiences to their customers.

color.description:
Primary color theme for whitelabel branding customization; supports color codes or color names with maximum 128
characters.

customDomain.description:
Custom domain name for whitelabel branding; allows organizations to use their own domain instead of the default platform
domain with maximum 64 characters.

logoImageUrl.description:
URL to the logo image for whitelabel branding customization; displayed in the application interface with maximum 512
characters for the URL path.

WhitelabelUpdate.description:
WhitelabelUpdate object is used for updating an existing whitelabel resource. Whitelabel is a branding configuration
controlling the visual appearance and identity of the platform. Whitelabel includes custom colors, logos, and domain

Workspace.description:
Workspace object represents a result/response for workspace resource. Workspace is a sub-organization allowing
agencies to manage multiple client accounts within a single parent organization. Workspace has its own users, campaigns,
prospects, and API key for isolated data management, providing complete separation between different client accounts.

workspaceId.description: Unique identifier for the workspace (sub-organization) within the agency.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the workspace was created in the system.

title.description: Display name of the workspace; maximum 256 characters.

apiKey.description: API key for authenticating requests made on behalf of this workspace, represented as a GUID.
